questionTitle: When factories are ________ by management, then workers tend to lose their jobs.
Roland: Have the children had supper yet? Marion: No, and they're not used ________ it so late.
"Be careful, Stuart, Paola has her eyes ________ you," Carol said.
In spite of the anaesthetic, Pauline was fully ________ during the operation.
This morning the postman was ________ down the street by my dog.
I don't ________ to see her again until next Tuesday.
Some drivers, after ________, annoy their fellow-motorists by slowing down again immediately.
After two months, he had ________ news of what she was doing in London.
Now that my dad is retired, he enjoys ________ more time with his grandchildren.
His debt now amounts ________ $100.
You demand too much of him; he is not really equal ________ the task.
Even though he is thirty five, he lives on his mother and is completely dependent ________ her.
Will you have ________ to tell her the truth?
Parents and children ________ enjoyed the show.
The programme of reconstruction in the city centre is now ________.
The production comes along well, although there were some ________ at the very beginning.
If I could understand this text, I ________ the next page.
Please ________ and see us some time - you're always welcome
I could ________ a note of panic in his voice.
Thousands of people use the ________ of footpaths across these hills.
